sub_title: Assistant Professor at University of Amsterdam
summary:
Ph.D. in Sciences, with specialization in Physics, from the University of Minho, Portugal. 
Assistant Professor, Informatics Institute, University of Amsterdam
Co-lead POLDER center, Institute for Advanced Study, University of Amsterdam
Program development coordinator MSc Complex Systems and Policy, Institute for Interdisciplinary Studies, University of Amsterdam 

Interests:
Human-environment complexity, Dilemmas of public-goods provision, scientific programming, stochastic time series analysis, evolution of cooperation, complex networks, and Statistical Physics.

projects.title: Theory of “club” agreements
projects.description: Through examples of clubs that form within or outside of existing regimes, test our understanding for the potential of small agreements to unlock global cooperation.

projects.title: Predictability in Stochastic Systems
projects.description: We introduce a general procedure for directly ascertaining how many independent stochastic sources exist in a complex system, useful in data analysis.

projects.title: Nuclear Reaction and the Origin of the Universe
projects.description: Aiming the familiarity with the Nuclear Physics field, it was studied the importance of nuclear radiactive capture reactions in the calculus of primordial abundances during the nucleosynthesis process, following the Big Bang model. In the context of a very simple model, cross section and astrophysic factor were calculated for the formation of Helium at low energy.
